## INCOME

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}
income <- read.csv("C:/Users/Brody/Documents/CKME136/DATASETS FOR ECONOMIC SUCCESS/income/income.csv")
```

Rename.
```{r}
names(income)[1] <- "Date"
names(income)[2] <- "Geo"
names(income)[5] <- "Type"
names(income)[12] <- "Value"
```

Select attributes we want.
```{r}
income <- income[, c("Date", "Geo", "Sex", "Type", "Value")]
```

toronto: Use SQLdf to filter by all sexes and median income.
```{r}
toronto_income <- sqldf("SELECT Date, Value FROM income WHERE Sex = 'Both sexes' AND Type = 'Median total income of tax filers with total income' AND Geo GLOB 'Toronto*' GROUP BY Date")
```

Toronto.
```{r}
#toronto_income <- sqldf("SELECT * FROM income_filter WHERE Geo GLOB 'Toronto*' GROUP BY Date")
```

```{r}
toronto_income <- toronto_income[-1 ,]
```
